flow.descriptionCdata:
52082014-02b0-4a75-b1a7-92b93cb77568.5475dffb-bd5f-4772-ab4d-0ead20fd2d15.description=
Useful Op to keep a running results.
Takes a string input (resultText) and appends this to a global context key of "runningResults". As a result, the context key whose name is in the keyName input will be appended with the string from the input resultText.

Input Parameters\:
keyName - name of context key to append to
resultText - string input to append
delimiter - (leave blank for none) the delimiter to put between what is already in keyName before appending resultText

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Returns\:
The value of the context variable it appended to.

Context\:
runningResults

Scriptlet Example\:
currentResults \= scriptletContext.get("runningResults");

if (currentResults \=\= null) {
   currentResults \= resultText;
} else {
   currentResults +\= resultText;
}


scriptletContext.putGlobal("runningResults", currentResults);
52082014-02b0-4a75-b1a7-92b93cb77568.606a631f-2f79-4731-985f-d514efa800e2.description=
This operation does not do anything. It can be used to filter flow variables by defining them as inputs and filtering them in the Results tab.

Inputs\:
    field1 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field2 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field3 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field4 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the value of  "field1" as it was specified at input or when filtered. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
52082014-02b0-4a75-b1a7-92b93cb77568.64574daf-48fa-466c-ab1f-6d7b01f3a227.description=
This operation checks whether a string matches another string, using a specific matching rule. The "toMatch" input is the string that is checked for matching the "matchTo" expression. 

Inputs\:
    matchType - The type of match to perform.
Valid values\: Exact Match, Contains, Contains Once, Does Not Contain, Match All Words, Match No Words, Regex (The values are not case sensitive)
Default value\: Exact Match
    toMatch - The string that is checked for matching.
    matchTo - The string to match against.
Example\: If "matchType" is “RegEx”, the "matchTo" input is a regular expression such as\: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. 
    ignoreCase - Specifies whether to ignore case when matching or not.
Valid values\: False, True
Default value\: False

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the string "Matches" if the "toMatch" string matches the "matchTo" string. Otherwise, it contains the string "Does Not Match".  

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
52082014-02b0-4a75-b1a7-92b93cb77568.8de39df1-9238-4cb6-8f57-ee2a7898cde7.description=<pre> This operation runs a SQL SELECT query. The first row is returned on the first run of the operation. Subsequent calls with the same information will return the other rows. Inputs\: DBServerName - The hostname or ip address of the database server. DbType - The type of database to connect to. Valid values\: Oracle, MSSQL, Sybase, Netcool, DB2, PostgreSQL and Custom. Default value\: Oracle Username - The username to use when connecting to the server. Password - The password to use when connecting to the server. instance - The name instance of MSSQL Server. Leave it blank for default instance. Example\: MSSQLSERVER DbPort - The port to connect to. Valid values\: Oracle\: 1521, MSSQL\: 1433, Sybase\: 5000, Netcool\: 4100, DB2\: 50000, PostgreSQL\: 5432. Database - The name of the database to connect to. authenticationType - The type of authentication used to access the database (applicable only to MSSQL type). Valid values\: sql, windows (for MSSQL) default value\: sql dbClass - The class name of the JDBC driver to use. dbURL - The URL required to load up the driver and make your connection. Command - The SQL query to execute. Delimiter - The delimiter to use between resulted values in "returnResult" and column names in "columnNames". Key - The key to help keep multiple query results distinct. timeout - Seconds to wait before timing out the SQL command execution. When the default value is used, there is no limit on the amount of time allowed for a running command to complete. Default values\: 0 databasePoolingProperties - Properties for database pooling configuration. This parameter replaces the databasePooling.properties file from 9x version (you may copy-paste the file content here). Pooling is disabled by default. For more details check the /Library/Operations/Database/JDBC folder description. Example\: db.pooling.enable\=true resultSetType - the result set type. See JDBC folder description for more details. Valid values\: TYPE_FORWARD_ONLY, TYPE_SCROLL_INSENSITIVE,TYPE_SCROLL_SENSITIVE. Default value\: TYPE_SCROLL_INSENSITIVE except DB2 which is overridden to TYPE_FORWARD_ONLY resultSetConcurrency - the result set concurrency. See JDBC folder description for more details. Valid values\: CONCUR_READ_ONLY, CONCUR_UPDATABLE Default value\: CONCUR_READ_ONLY ignoreCase - If set to true the inputs' letters case will be ignored and converted to lowercase. Valid values\: true, false Default value\: true Results\: returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the data of one row, separated by the "Delimiter". columnNames - The names of all the columns returned, separated by the "Delimiter". rowsLeft - The number of remaining rows that match the query. Responses\: more items - More rows are available for retrieval. no more items - No more rows are available. failure - Failed to execute the command. Notes\: 1. SQL statement other than SELECT statement (like INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE) is not supported. In case statements other than SELECT are executed then the operation will fail but the statements might get partially or fully executed in the database. 2. If the column type is "ntext", the "returnResult" returns the name of the JDBC driver instead of the actual column value. In this case, use the "SQL Query LOB" operation instead. 3. Use the 'Command' input with caution as it can expose the target system to security risks. By exposing the 'Command' input as a prompt to the user, it will enable the user to execute any SQL command on the target system taking into account the permissions of the credentials given as inputs. Note\: Check the JDBC folder description for details on how to load database connectors. </pre> 52082014-02b0-4a75-b1a7-92b93cb77568.9f13a769-e947-42d1-8c16-b3e7419e7c9a.description=
This operation does not do anything. It can be used to filter flow variables by defining them as inputs and filtering them in the Results tab.

Inputs\:
    field1 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field2 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field3 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field4 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the value of  "field1" as it was specified at input or when filtered. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
52082014-02b0-4a75-b1a7-92b93cb77568.cc3b504c-4d82-44ac-a6f3-e5eb1cf06e94.description=
This operation checks whether a string matches another string, using a specific matching rule. The "toMatch" input is the string that is checked for matching the "matchTo" expression. 

Inputs\:
    matchType - The type of match to perform.
Valid values\: Exact Match, Contains, Contains Once, Does Not Contain, Match All Words, Match No Words, Regex (The values are not case sensitive)
Default value\: Exact Match
    toMatch - The string that is checked for matching.
    matchTo - The string to match against.
Example\: If "matchType" is “RegEx”, the "matchTo" input is a regular expression such as\: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. 
    ignoreCase - Specifies whether to ignore case when matching or not.
Valid values\: False, True
Default value\: False

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the string "Matches" if the "toMatch" string matches the "matchTo" string. Otherwise, it contains the string "Does Not Match".  

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
52082014-02b0-4a75-b1a7-92b93cb77568.cdef9d90-c19d-4fb4-94fb-28cfe79bce7f.description=
Useful Op to keep a running results.
Takes a string input (resultText) and appends this to a global context key of "runningResults". As a result, the context key whose name is in the keyName input will be appended with the string from the input resultText.

Input Parameters\:
keyName - name of context key to append to
resultText - string input to append
delimiter - (leave blank for none) the delimiter to put between what is already in keyName before appending resultText

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Returns\:
The value of the context variable it appended to.

Context\:
runningResults

Scriptlet Example\:
currentResults \= scriptletContext.get("runningResults");

if (currentResults \=\= null) {
   currentResults \= resultText;
} else {
   currentResults +\= resultText;
}


scriptletContext.putGlobal("runningResults", currentResults);

Useful Op to keep a running results.
Takes a string input (resultText) and appends this to a global context key of "runningResults". As a result, the context key whose name is in the keyName input will be appended with the string from the input resultText.

Input Parameters\:

flow.name: Obtain Settlement Details

step.name: SLS Customer details and stax ID
Set Condition to obtain settlement details

staticBinding.value: Select ID,Comments from SSCIndex where CustomerID=${slsCustomerId} and DocType='${activityType}' and Status in ${status}
